page.title: 04Tavistock Houses -old & new
page.content: Many of the houses in our area were built in the 60s and 70s,although some were built as early as the 1800s.Some houses in Tavistock were built for the {Duke of Bedford's}mine workers.In the main street most of the houses are above the shops. On the moors most of the houses are very old.{Devon {Longhouses}are the oldest,built around the 1600s. They were built on hills and had two levels.They had a door at the top, and a ladder leading to the bottom where the animals used to live. St.David's and Campion Rise are some of the newest developments: College Avenue and Old Exeter Road are the oldest streets.A majority of the houses in Tavistock are semi-detached. The housing area around Greenlands is mostly council houses although approximately 30% of these are now owner-occupied.
